intro: Zosterophyllanthos corysta, commonly known as the coastal zosterophyllum, is a rare and ancient plant species belonging to the order Zosterophyllales. It is characterized by its simple, ribbon-like leaves that are typically found in shallow marine environments. The plant exhibits a unique structure with a central axis and branching fronds, resembling early forms of vascular plants. Its reproductive structures are not well understood, but it is believed to reproduce through spores. This plant provides valuable insights into the evolutionary transition from marine to terrestrial life in early plant evolution.
